Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Newly Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: duchessoflondon
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large rooms. Hotel is just off Passieg De Gracia & shopping area. Staff was very helpful. Close to many local attractions - an easy walk to Gaudi, Market de la Concepcio.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but quiet”
Reviews.Author: Zrinka2
Reviews.Content: Nice big clean rooms. Only problem was we were a couple and the king sized bed was made by pushing two doubles together. Huge bathroom, wood floors, nice big windows. A nice room to come back to after a long day exploring barcelona. A bit of a walk to old city and Las Ramblas, but this was perfect for us. The best thing was the free & refilled mini bar on daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: katie b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms are large by European standards and average based on American standards. We stayed her 2 days pre-cruise and 4 post-cruise. I would definately stay here again. I would not, however, eat at yr resturant inside. It is such a good neighborhood that you are never more than 5 minutes walking away from a good place to eat. I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Hols1981
Reviews.Content: The only reason we didn't give 5 is because of the renovations that are being carried out at the moment and there were parts of the hotel that we could not go. However when the hotel is finished, it will definately be fantastic! We were unable to hear any work going on and it did not disrupt our stay in any way. The rooms are spacious and we had a balcony overlooking the Barcelona skyline. It is a perfect location, just around the corner from the main streets. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better location”
Reviews.Author: TCorrigan
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance of most attractions in central Barcelona. Friendly, helpful staff and modern,clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OscarTwinCities
Reviews.Content: Perfect for people who like to walk. Within a 25-30 minute walk you are at most sites. Also, it is two blocks for the Rambla Catalunya,a smaller Rambla parallel to the Passeo de Gracia. If you hated the main tourist Rambla, this is for you. It is quiet, few tourist, mostly locals, and beautiful at night. Great value as of now. Grab it before the prices go up after the renovation (unobtrusive) is over in May.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: cupcakeBangkok
Reviews.Content: Great location one block away from great shopping, bars and restaurants. It is under major construction. There was no lobby, besides a counter to check-in, only the hotel bar and breakfast restaurant. We stayed in a renovated suite (small but with a nice sitting room that could be closed off from bedroom) was was nicely decorated with subtle cream, blue and beige. Hotel staff very helpful and attentive. The roof top terrace and gym were not open due to renovation. Very easy to walk everywhere and taxis were easy to find right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: HendrikM
Reviews.Content: Great location just one block away from Passeig de Gracia, avoiding all the noise but easy access to restaurants, shops and transport. The hotel was under renovation so it was a bit messy,noisy and smelly at places but they were very careful to minimize disruptions. It is very modern, comfortable and clean. The only problem I had was the room temperature as the air conditioning in my room wasn’t working properly but I was moved immediately to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pazboston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine as a business hotel. The location is very convenient - only a few blocks from the metro, taxis right outside the door and only a block or so off the Passeig de Gracia. The neighborhood has many great restaurants (and not just at expense account prices, either!) and feels safe to walk around even late in the evening. As a woman traveling alone for business I felt very safe in the area. There is a school across one of the streets, so at school breaks you will find tons of children and parents in the streets, but I never found my room to be noisy despite the intermittent crowd. The wi-fi is reliable in the rooms, and zippy enough for video conferencing, which was very helpful. I noticed the TV reception was a bit wavy, but I wasn't watching TV enough for it to impact my experience. The desk is well laid-out and spacious, it wasn't hard to get work done at this hotel. For the neighborhood, the hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located expensive business hotel”
Reviews.Author: durjay
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed in this hotel (four times) on business and it has never surprised me. I think that could be a problem. Business trips can become boring and a few pleasant surprises help to lift up the mood. The rooms size is good but luckily I got a bigger room on my last visit. It was not a surprise since at 250 euros a night I was expecting better value. On an average I would rate it as a 100 euro hotel and once it is a fully integrated Marriott do not expect anything less than 200 for the same. I do not think I would stay here again as one is spoilt for choice in Barcelona and as long as you are close to Plaza Catalunya & Passeig De Gracias you should be fine. Best points are: free mini bar, location, nice bed and friendly staff (front office). It also has smoking rooms / floor (which is good for me) Bad points are: the wifi internet does not work in the rooms (I have tried all the different cards and companies) and expensive breakfast. If you can manage a price of 150 euros it is still value but anything more than that is a rip-off. I also feel that a business hotel must have the best internet. There would be a lot of travelers who would like to sit in their room late nights in comfortable clothing and work on their mails & presentations rather than sitting in the lobby trying to figure out which chair/sofa would be comfortable and quiet .... Currently they are undergoing renovations and I have since found better hotels at lesser prices around the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs it current renovation”
Reviews.Author: Neale1810
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for a couple of days. Its now part of the Marriott group but frustratingly you won't get Marriott points until April. The hotel is covered in scaffolding and lots of renovation going on to upgrade it to a Renaissance. This work is needed to modernise it so I forgive them for the noise - actually they are doing what they can to still run the hotel as normal. Stayed in room 217 which was rather basic for a business hotel but did have a free mini bar. Had room service one night which arrived promptly and was good quality. Breakfast was good. Will be back later in the year to see if the improvements have been worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: BeatleBugUK
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip to the AC Diplomatic in Barcelona. Didn't eat there in the evenings but breakfast was good. The location was central and taxi drivers knew where to find it. There was a free minibar in the rooms and it was possible to use free wifi in the bar. To have wifi in the rooms this had to be paid for. Alotgether the rooms were very clean and modern. The only problem I noticed was that the room key had to be in the wall for the electricity to come on, this meant I couldn't leave anything on charge whilst out of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenfro Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel several times during businesstrips. Great location just 10 min walk from Plaza Catalunya and nearby Metro. A small gym and a rooftop swimmingpool. Great breakfastbuffe and nice lobbybar with free wifi. Superior rooms little bigger, but standardroom is as good as them. Some room with balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SGabelman
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and good. Staff. Although rennovation going on, they didn't make you feel you were in a construction site.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction:Ok if you don't mind noise!!”
Reviews.Author: Jobetraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked in Oct with no notice or warning of the hotel being under a major remodel. We were very surprised to discover the whole hotel under scaffolding. One of the major reasons we selected this hotel was for its gym... But it was closed !! ( when we complained they did offer us breakfast and Internet for the inconvenience.. That was nice...) However we soon discovered that the men outside our window on the 4th floor ( remember the scaffold?) came with noise!! They worked from 8am until 7pm each day with and steady hammering ... Very annoying AND they worked on Saturday! Trust us ..do not visit until after their remodel is done!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leegns
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. One of the things that we found out the hard way was that this hotel is used by Holland America for any cruise passengers that want to extend their stay at the end of their trip. When we arrived the lobby was complete chaos! There were about 100 senior citizens in the lobby waiting to check in. Only one person was checking people in and 2 others were just standing around. We weren't part of the group so the bell hop told us to just walk up to the desk and not bother waiting. When we approached the desk they said they were for check out only and that they couldn't check us in even though there was no one to check out. So basically that person was standing there useless. We stood in line for an hour and all the cruise ship seniors kept cutting in front of us (which I get isn't really the hotel's fault but they clearly need a better process to deal with mass amount of people while not ticking off other customers!) After the first hour we gave up and abandoned our bags in the lobby to go get some food and explore the city. We returned hours later to check in and decided to complain about the poor service. We asked to talk to a manager who didn't even bother to apologize for our bad experience until about 5 minutes into the conversation and even then it wasn't a real apology. She even tried to tell us that there was more than one person checking people in even though there wasn't. NOT the way to deal with an unhappy customer!!! This is the SERVICE industry!!! The ONLY reason we stayed there was because it was already pre-paid on my credit card. Within a 4 block radius there are numerous other hotels that all looked like they would be a lot better! Now the room!! GROSS!!! It looked like a hockey team had partied in it. Every piece of furniture was dented, scratched or in some way damaged! NOT AT ALL LIKE THE PICTURES!!! And in the bathroom SOMETHING was growing on the shower tile. We didn't even bother to complain again given our first experiences with the front desk. This place is a dump and NOT worth the money even on a deep discount!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, safe and well located”
Reviews.Author: stonedrift
Reviews.Content: Travelling with another couple, my wife and i made this our home in Barcelona for ten days in October 2010 (although the calendar on this website only let me choose October 2011). The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to many of the sites within this wonderful city. Smallish elevators and rooms although very clean and modern. The main floor lobby bar was quite expensive but you aren't staying for the food. The staff were quite friendly and helped recommend many restaurants and sites to see. The internet connection is quite good. Close to the shopping, eateries and excellent sites.

Reviews.Title: “Its a no brainer”
Reviews.Author: Bugles
Reviews.Content: Even though I am starting on a negative note, I must already say that this is a good hotel. This hotel will neither Wow you nor does it have the most convenient location. But overall this hotel captures the essence of hospitality. When you just go as a couple to have a nice wkend in BCN, this hotel is like your favourite companion. Smooth arrival, easy to find, warm welcome, clean and specious rooms, great value for money, comfy bed, soothing amenities, free mini bar, free wireless in Lobby, funny concierge. What else can someone ask for? We didnt go to BCN to stay in a hotel, rather to explore the city. Thats why this hotel played a key part in not giving us any troubles, being silently in the background keeping us safe, clean, informed and well relaxed to enjoy the city. Thats why its a no brainer to choose this stay if you just want a simple relaxing wkend in BCN. If you do spend more time in the hotel, there is the gym and a small pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: VickiD
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel we stayed at in Barcelona for 4 nights after flying in from the US in October 2011. We had a great stay here. It was clean, comfortable and upscale. Very quiet room with comfortable bed and lots of space. The best thing was the location, kind of in the center of everything we wanted to see. Two blocks from the main shopping street in Barcelona, which had an endless choice of restaurants and cafes to choose from as well as Gaudi's amazing Casa Batllo which was our favorite site by far. I highly recommend this as a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: minandmick
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed her one night before we boarded on our cruise. It was clean and the staff was so helpful, so I don't understand some of the complaints. I would stay here again if I ever went back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Had remembered it being better”
Reviews.Author: MymAustralia
Reviews.Content: My memory of our first time in the AC Hotel Diplomatic is better than the experience this time. This time we found the street noise distressing but the first time we'd looked over a back area and it was much quieter. Quiet is not easy to come by in Barcelona. The street view was not particularly attractive in our eyes, although it gave us natural light and kind-of fresh air and the streets around here are a Barcelona attraction. We were reasonably high up, and imagine that the ambience would deteriorate going down. We had paid for a superior room: I wonder if our original room was a standard room and not as highly regarded because it didn't have the view of the streets. I had remembered about the complimentary minibar, but it only had beer for one person, not two. We like to enjoy a beer when we first arrive somewhere, when we're settling in. Instead of appreciating it being free, we were disgruntled about having to share the one. They knew the room was being booked for two, so there's no excuse that most guests seemed to be solo business travellers or groups. Wifi in the room was paid, but it was free down in the lobby. The reception staff did not explain how to log on to it, so I had to ask again for specific instructions after failing to get on. I'd thought I'd sit there, do emails and have a quiet drink but nobody ever came to take an order, which I guess was healthier for me, if not for the hotel's profits, and the bar didn't have anything particularly interesting to offer. The best service was at the door. The assistance with luggage when we arrived was much appreciated. We had lots of bits and pieces and needed to get them inside securely, check in and to have the luggage looked after while we returned a rental car several kms away. I was conscious of security and the door staff also made a point of reminding me (sensible of them, as many people are woefully naive when on holidays). When we returned the luggage had all been taken up to the room. A taxi also was arranged promptly when it was needed when we were departing. That was the exception when it came to staff. We came back from breakfast on our first morning there to find our room being cleaned, and the chambermaid wanted to finish all the elements of the job; I had to specifically tell her not to. Service was also distinctly lacking at the breakfast area. The arrangement for coffee seemed to be self service. Not only does this disrupt meals, but guests weren't being told that this was the case and had to either eventually ask when they were going to get their coffee, or work it out for themselves. Both the room and breakfast service indicates processes and training that are driven by efficiencies rather than delivering good customer experience. I don't think I'll be back a third time.

HotelInfo.Name: Diplomatic Hotel Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Pau Claris 122, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
